snippet: Nigerians are getting used to being checked for fever at airports and nightclubs.
abstract: Op-Ed article by writer Alexis Okeowo describes climate of fear surrounding Ebola outbreak in Nigeria, despite fact that numbers are very low due to official intervention; says despite concerns, Nigerians continue to live life, celebrate with friends and family and experience joy; adds Ebola, nonetheless, has become ever-present part of life.
lead_paragraph: Nigerians are getting used to being checked for fever at airports and nightclubs.

headline.main: Living With the Terror of Ebola
headline.print_headline: Living With the Terror of Ebola
